definition: a chemical compound found in animals and plants that is necessary for a healthy body and growth
forest that grows in wet ground in far northern regions of the earth
causing the user to see and hear things that are not there or that do not exist (= to hallucinate)
having bright colours, strange sounds, etc. like those that are experienced when taking psychedelic drugs
a drug, such as LSD, that affects people’s minds and makes them see and hear things that are not really there
a person who has pyromania
a person who enjoys making or watching fires
the principle or practice of protecting a country’s own industry by taxing foreign goods
in a way that shows very strong feelings, especially anger
a type of software that is designed to block access to a computer system until a sum of money is paid
connected with the earth's atmosphere and its changes, especially in the way they affect the weather
the use of computer technology to attack the information systems of a state or organization, preventing them from carrying out important activities
to move forward at a speed that is faster than a walk and slower than a canter
to ride a horse in this way

to walk or go somewhere

to be excited in a sexual way
to make somebody sad and without enthusiasm or hope
to make trade, business, etc. less active
to make the value of prices or wages lower
to press or push something down, especially part of a machine
to arrange something in a particular way, especially computer equipment; to make equipment or software work in the way that the user prefers
to fill or use a space, an area or an amount of time
to live or work in a room, house or building
to enter a place in a large group and take control of it, especially by military force
to fill your time or keep you busy doing something
to have an official job or position
a wonderful and surprising person or thing
wonderful results or things that have been achieved
to disagree strongly with somebody’s plan, policy, etc. and try to change it or prevent it from succeeding
to compete with somebody in a contest

a discussion or an examination of an event after it has happened, especially in order to find out why it failed
to take the place of somebody/something (especially somebody/something older or less modern)
to buy insurance so that you will receive money if your property, car, etc. gets damaged or stolen, or if you get ill or die
to sell insurance to somebody for something
to make sure that something happens or is definite

to pay somebody an amount of money because of the damage or loss that they have suffered
to pay back money to somebody which they have spent or lost

to fight back when attacked; to use force to stop something from happening
to stop yourself from having something you like or doing something you very much want to do
to not be harmed or damaged by something

to pay money regularly to be a member of an organization or to support a charity

to apply to take part in an activity, use a service, etc.

to write something on a surface by cutting into it
to cut a large piece of cooked meat into smaller pieces for eating

unable to be changed
to make figures or objects by carving or shaping wood, stone, clay, metal, etc.
to give something a particular shape
if an idea or feeling impels you to do something, you feel as if you are forced to do it

to put somebody/something in an unpleasant situation
to give or send something to somebody
to raise or pull something up to a higher position, often using ropes or special equipment

to hold on tightly to somebody/something
to stick to something
